definition: medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
Avatamsaka sutra of the Huayan school/also called Buddhavatamsaka-mahavaipulya Sutra, the Flower adornment sutra or the Garland sutra
pinyin: da4 fang1 guang3 Fo2 hua2 yan2 jing1

definition: the Four Noble Truths (Buddhism)/see also 四諦|四谛[si4 di4] and 苦集滅道|苦集灭道[ku3 ji2 mie4 dao4]
the Nirvana sutra: every living thing has Buddha nature.
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
Chakravarti raja (Sanskrit: King of Kings)/emperor in Hindu mythology
Buddha Kassapa (Pāli) or Kāśyapa (Skt) (one of the Buddhas of the past)
boundless life (expression of good wishes)/Amitayus, the Buddha of measureless life, good fortune and wisdom
